body.p: The Interpretations Committee observed that IAS 1 Presentation of Financial Statements sets out general features for the financial statements, including the accrual basis of accounting and the going concern assumption. The Interpretations Committee noted that, when an entity prepares financial statements on a going concern basis, it shall also comply with all the recognition and measurement requirements of IFRS. Consequently, the Interpretations Committee concluded that the going concern assumption cannot lead to the recognition of a liability that does not meet the definitions and recognition criteria set out in IAS 37.
